feedback:
Excellent application of the DRIVER framework throughout your work. You clearly demonstrated 6 stages: D, R, I, V, E, R2.


STRENGTHS:
- Integrate AI: The submission demonstrates a functioning AI integration that adds clear value (automated, categorized uploads to a spreadsheet) and includes implementation details and iteration to correct model behavior. The evidence across Discover, Implement, and Reflect shows the AI is meaningfully integrated rather than superficial.


AREAS FOR IMPROVEMENT:
- Financial APP: The student demonstrates a working financial tool that records and categorizes expenses (evidence: automated add and sheet entry), showing implementation and iteration. However, treatment is limited to a single demo and brief discussion of improvements and applications, so it shows correct functionality but not the comprehensive depth required for a full PASS.

criteria.criterion_name: Financial APP: The tool functions as a financial application.
evidence: "I created an expense tracker. Specifically, it would solve the problem of having to go into an Excel like for a budget and input them all there, which is quite time consuming. And I just I created this AI agent that would I would give it my expenses in real time as I incur them and it would automatically upload it to the Excel budget"
"And so then I would send it and then we're going to wait for it to add it. Okay. So, it said, 'Got it. Adding an expense for Aldi, $120 under groceries.'"
"And so, then I can go back into it. And there it is. You can see that it's today's date, the correct date, the amount, Aldi, and groceries."
criteria.driver_alignment: Discover — identified a budgeting pain point and proposed an AI agent to automate expense entry; Implement — demonstrated the agent adding a real expense to a Google Sheet; Reflect — iteratively refined the system message when categories were misassigned ("it kept on adding the same... it only did dining out for everything. So then I had to tweak the system message").
criteria.reasoning: The student demonstrates a working financial tool that records and categorizes expenses (evidence: automated add and sheet entry), showing implementation and iteration. However, treatment is limited to a single demo and brief discussion of improvements and applications, so it shows correct functionality but not the comprehensive depth required for a full PASS.

criteria.criterion_name: Integrate AI: The tool integrates AI capabilities effectively.
evidence: "I created this AI agent that would I would give it my expenses in real time as I incur them and it would automatically upload it to the Excel budget"
"You have all of the chat model, the memory and the tool which is add entry entry."

"it kept on adding the same like no matter what different category I gave it, it did all one category like it only did dining out for everything. So then I had to tweak the system message to actually categorize things on its own."
criteria.driver_alignment: The DISCOVER stage identifies a concrete problem and AI-based solution (real-time expense capture). The IMPLEMENT stage shows a working agent connected to a Google Sheet with a chat model, memory, and an add-entry tool and demonstrates an example transaction. The REFLECT stage documents iterative tuning of the system message to improve automated categorization.
criteria.reasoning: The submission demonstrates a functioning AI integration that adds clear value (automated, categorized uploads to a spreadsheet) and includes implementation details and iteration to correct model behavior. The evidence across Discover, Implement, and Reflect shows the AI is meaningfully integrated rather than superficial.
